metadata.title: CVE-2022-21499 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
KGDB and KDB allow read and write access to kernel memory, and thus shouldbe restricted during lockdown. An attacker with access to a serial portcould trigger the debugger so it is important that the debugger respect thelockdown mode when/if it is triggered. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 6.7(Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21499` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1082-fips - 4.4.0-1082.89
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
